subject: AI & Agents
title: AlphaGo: The Game Nobody Thought AI Could Win
description: A fast breakdown of AlphaGo: The Game Nobody Thought AI Could Win for builders.

hook.text: Go has more possible positions than atoms in the universe. In 2016, AI mastered it.

buildup.text: DeepMind's AlphaGo combined deep learning with Monte Carlo tree search.

discovery.text: It beat world champion Lee Sedol 4-1. Move 37 in Game 2 was unlike anything a human had ever played.

twist.text: Lee Sedol's single winning game â€” his 'divine move' â€” brought the audience to tears.

climax.text: AlphaGo Zero later surpassed it by learning entirely from self-play â€” no human games needed.

punchline.text: The machine didn't just beat humans. It invented new moves.

quiz.question: What made AlphaGo's Move 37 remarkable?
options: It was a strategy no human had ever played
It was the fastest move ever made
It was identical to a famous historical game
